translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Phaladāyaka as the Name-Donor
The Elder Kurañciyaphaladāyaka’s Birth Story
“In the past I was a hunter,
wandering in the forest;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
who had gone beyond all things.

analyzed: kurañciya phalam  buddha seṭṭhaḥ sadā saha
translated: Taking a kurañjika fruit,🔽I always served the best Buddha;
I was confident with my hands
in that field of merit.
Thirty-one eons ago,
the fruit I gave then;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
My defilements are burned up,
all my existences are destroyed;
Like an elephant who has broken its bonds,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the best Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations;
The six supernormal knowledges have been realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kurañciyaphaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kurañciyaphaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Kurañciyaphaladāyaka recited these verses.
